required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Temporomandibular Dysfunction in Patients With Tinnitus: Assessment and Treatment
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Conservative Treatment of Temporomandibular Disorders on Somatic Tinnitus

brief_summary.textblock: TMD treatment, based on state of the art knowledge derived from clinical studies will be applied in patients with tinnitus and TMD. When this approach proves to be useful for the treatment of tinnitus, it offers a new therapeutic option for patients with tinnitus. To understand how TMD treatment works for patients with tinnitus, we will analyse mediating factors, i.e. factors that contribute to the therapeutic effect. To help clinicians in their clinical process we will identify prognostic indicators, i.e. factors that predict a positive or negative outcome of TMD treatment. This can provide a helpful tool in clinical practice.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: One study arm will be treated immediately after inclusion. The other study arm will be treated after a delay of 9 weeks. During these 9 weeks patients will be on a waiting list.

primary_outcome.description: Questionnaire to measure the change in tinnitus related distress

secondary_outcome.description: Questionnaire to measure the change in tinnitus severity
Questionnaire to measure the presence of hyperacusis

secondary_outcome.measure: Visual analogue scale for tinnitus loudness
secondary_outcome.description: Scale to measure the change in average tinnitus loudness
Questionnaire to assess the presence of and change in temporomandibular disorders(TMD) symptoms
Questionnaire to measure the presence of anxiety and/or depression
pre-defined list of questions on duration of the tinnitus complaints, modulation, bruxism,...

secondary_outcome.measure: Static investigation of the temporomandibular joint
secondary_outcome.description: evaluation of change in isometric contraction of jaw muscles

secondary_outcome.measure: Dynamic investigation of the temporomandibular joint
secondary_outcome.description: evaluation of change in isotonic contraction of jaw muscles
measurement of change in pain pressure thresholds on masseter, temporalis, temporomandibular joint, sternocleidomastoideus, tibialis anterior
change in mouth opening measured in cm with a ruler

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain on palpation of masseter, temporalis and temporomandibular joint
secondary_outcome.description: change in recognisable pain on palpation, measured on numerical rating scale
analysis of the tinnitus type, pitch and loudness
analysis of the change in understanding spoken words in a noisy situation
change in EEG during listening tasks

arm_group.description: Patients receive the TMD treatment immediately
No intervention in the first 9 weeks of the study. Afterwards, the patients receive the same treatment as the other group

intervention.intervention_name: TMD treatment: physiotherapy and/or occlusal splints
intervention.description: The patient will receive the most appropriate TMD treatment, based on current literature.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients will be included when suffering from somatic tinnitus, attributed to TMD, which has been stable for at least 3 months.
- Tinnitus Functional Index score between 25 and 90
Exclusion Criteria:
- clear otological or neurological causes of the tinnitus such as Meni√®re's disease, severe depression (diagnosed by a psychologist), progressive middle ear pathology, intracranial pathology
- traumatic cervical spine or temporomandibular injury in the past 6 months
- tumours
- previous surgery in the orofacial area
- in case physical therapy treatment directed to the orofacial area is contra-indicated
- if the patient received TMD treatment in the past 2 months
- drug intake that can affect the outcome measures

overall_contact.last_name: Paul Van de Heyning, PhD, MD
